org.adroitlogic.ultraesb.api

Class AbstractJavaSequence

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.adroitlogic.ultraesb.api.AbstractJavaSequence
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    JavaClassSequence, JavaCodeSnippetSequence

    public abstract class AbstractJavaSequence
extends java.lang.Object
implements JavaClassSequence
    This is the recommended class for end users to override to implement a sequence Note: To enable sequence debugging on/off, use a logger with the name as "sequence." e.g. For a sequence with the id "my-sequence" private static final Logger logger = LoggerFactory.getLogger("sequence.my-sequence");
    Since:
    1.4.0

           Mediation mediation)

        Executes the Java code sequence with the available message
        Specified by:
        execute in interface JavaCodeSnippetSequence
        Parameters:
        msg - current message to execute the Java code snippet sequence with
        mediation - a reference to the mediation utilities
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - on an exception thrown by the sequence implementation

      • init

        public void init(Configuration config)
        Description copied from interface: JavaClassSequence
        Initializes the sequence with the current Configuration Note: a sequence may be initialized, before the ESB decides to send any messages to it. For example, when switching a running configuration, one may attempt a preparation of a new configuration, and at this time all sequences will get initialized via this call back. However, the user may decide not to use this configuration, or proceed with a configuration switch, in which case this sequence may be destroyed again without being used
        Specified by:
        init in interface JavaClassSequence
        Parameters:
        config - the current Configuration of the UltraESB

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Description copied from interface: JavaClassSequence
        Destroys the sequence (e.g. before shutdown or unloading of the sequence)
        Specified by:
        destroy in interface JavaClassSequence
